meta.description: Luna Launcher: A lightweight, clean, and customizable Minecraft launcher focused on freedom and organization.

hero.title: Lightweight, Clean, and Customizable Minecraft Launcher
hero.description: Focused on instance isolation and making it easier to use: manage modpacks, update resources, and keep each world and configuration separate.
hero.notice: Early version: You may need to build it yourself or contact the developer for a test version.

features.title: Features
features.lead: Building on the Prism Launcher experience, making common tasks like installation, maintenance, and version switching easier.
features.modpack_desc: Easily install and launch modpacks while keeping your instance directory clean. Reduce repetitive manual installation, update, and troubleshooting work.
features.download_desc: Supports community mirror APIs (like BMCLAPI) for smoother downloads in China's network environment. BMCLAPI support is still being refined and may not be available in all scenarios.
features.instance_desc: Each instance has independent mods, resource packs, and settings. Prevents old versions from resetting settings or accidentally corrupting worlds.
features.p2p_desc: Built-in support for Terracotta and YukariConnect P2P multiplayer. Play with friends without port forwarding or complex network setup. YukariConnect is intended as an alternative to the AGPL-licensed Terracotta.
features.p2p_desc_more: Play with friends without port forwarding or complex network setup. YukariConnect is intended as an alternative to the AGPL-licensed Terracotta.
features.server_desc: Quickly access server preview from the toolbar, view server status and player information in real-time, and connect to your favorite servers with one click.
features.server_mgmt_desc: Launch and manage servers directly from the launcher, making it easy to play with friends. Suitable for small servers and casual multiplayer sessions.

get.title: Get Started
get.lead: Currently in early development: stable installation packages may not be available yet. Targeted at developers and early testers.
get.panel_build: Recommended: Build and run it yourself following the build guide. You can also check Releases for preview builds.
get.panel_contact: If you need a test version or encounter issues, feel free to contact the developer through Issues.
get.notice: Note: Mirror API support (including BMCLAPI) is still being improved. If you encounter download issues, please provide feedback so we can improve.

community.title: Community
community.lead: We carefully read every piece of feedback and welcome contributions to development.
community.feedback_desc: Submit issues, feature requests, or UI suggestions to GitHub Issues, and include logs and reproduction steps when possible.
community.contribute_desc: Whether it's fixing a small bug or providing new icons and UI designs, all contributions are valuable.

build.title: Build Guide
build.lead: This guide explains how to build Luna Launcher from source.

get_source.title: Get the Source
get_source.note: Note: Use --recursive to clone submodules (including website).

msys2_auto.title: Automated Build: MSYS2 + GCC (Recommended)
msys2_auto.desc: Uses MSYS2's UCRT64 GCC toolchain with automated build scripts.

msys2.title: Option A: MSYS2 + GCC (Recommended)
msys2.desc: Uses MSYS2's UCRT64 GCC toolchain with automated build scripts.

m2m.title: Using Msys2Manager (m2m)
m2m.desc: Msys2Manager (m2m) is a CLI tool for managing MSYS2 environments. Download the latest release from GitHub Releases and add it to your PATH.

msys2_manual.title: Manual Build: MSYS2 + GCC
msys2_manual.desc: CLANG64 or UCRT64 msystem are recommended. CLANG64 has faster compilation and fewer bugs.

prereq.title: Prepare MSYS2
prereq.step1: Open MSYS2 shortcut from the Start menu
prereq.step2: Install helper tools: pacman -Syu pactoys git mingw-w64-ucrt-x86_64-binutils
prereq.step3: Use pacboy to install build dependencies: pacboy -S toolchain:p cmake:p ninja:p qt6-base:p qt6-5compat:p qt6-svg:p qt6-imageformats:p quazip-qt6:p extra-cmake-modules:p ccache:p
prereq.step4: Or use Qt 5: pacboy -S toolchain:p cmake:p ninja:p qt5-base:p qt5-svg:p qt5-imageformats:p quazip-qt5:p extra-cmake-modules:p ccache:p

compile.title: Compile from command line
compile.comment5: # Portable build (data stored in app directory)

msys2_manual.note: Note: For Qt 5 builds, you need to manually copy OpenSSL DLLs: cp /ucrt64/bin/libcrypto-1_1-x64.dll /ucrt64/bin/libssl-1_1-x64.dll install

msvc_auto.title: Automated Build: Pixi + MSVC
msvc_auto.desc: MSVC only; run from x64 Native Tools Command Prompt.

msvc.title: Option B: Pixi + MSVC
msvc.desc: Uses Pixi with MSVC toolchain. Run from x64 Native Tools Command Prompt.

msvc_manual.title: Manual Build: MSVC

prereq.title: Dependencies
prereq.vs: Visual Studio - Run from "x64 Native Tools Command Prompt"

msvc_manual.note: Note: For Qt 5 builds, you need to manually copy OpenSSL DLLs: robocopy C:\Qt\Tools\OpenSSL\Win_x64\bin\ install libcrypto-1_1-x64.dll libssl-1_1-x64.dll

linux.title: Building on Linux
linux.system_note: Use /usr when building Linux packages, /usr/local for personal builds.

macos.title: Building on macOS
macos.sign_note: Note: The final app bundle may not run due to code signing issues. Use codesign -fs - to fix.
